### Tender Description

The Government of Canada, through Defence Construction Canada (DCC), is inviting proposals from qualified consulting firms for the replacement of the underground electrical distribution system at the St-Jean Garrison, Quebec. The project will involve providing consulting services, including a soil survey, preparation of a Statement of Requirement, concept, plans, and specifications.

The estimated construction cost of the project is approximately $20,000,000.

### Mandatory Documents

* Request for Abbreviated Proposals (RFAP)
* Tender Specifications
* Bidding and Contract Documents

### Tender Requirements

* Submission of bid documents through the MERX Electronic Bidding System
* Registration of interest for a non-mandatory site visit on October 19, 2023, to be conducted by contacting Marie-Eve Neron

### Award Criteria

* Total score based on established criteria outlined in the RFAP

### Security Requirements

* Identified in the RFAP documents

### Electrical Distribution System Replacement

* The project involves the replacement of underground electrical distribution systems at the St-Jean Garrison, Quebec
* The consulting firm will be responsible for providing consulting services, including a soil survey, preparation of a Statement of Requirement, concept, plans, and specifications

### Bidding and Documents

* Available on the MERX website (http://www.merx.com)
* Fees may apply; see (https://www.merx.com/public/pricing) for more information
